snippet: As American companies begin presenting second-quarter earnings, markets reflected an expectation that corporate fortunes would remain generally good, although the aluminum producer Alcoa reported a loss.
abstract: Stocks rise, with investors seeming cautiously optimistic about corporate earnings.
lead_paragraph: As American companies begin presenting second-quarter earnings, markets reflected an expectation that corporate fortunes would remain generally good, although the aluminum producer Alcoa reported a loss.

headline.main: Investors’ Wary Optimism Leads to Gains for Stocks
headline.print_headline: Investors’ Wary Optimism Leads to Gains for Stocks
